data.title: Informix vs SQL Server
data.meta_description: Has anyone seen any information where they compare and conrast Informix and SQL Server? In searching I have found tons comparing SQL/Oracle/MySQL but Informix is NEVER considered in the mix… why?
data.text:
Most managers are not techies, and will not undersatand numbers. They will

understand that the Informix db is so fragile and arcane no-one will try

modifying it to do what it needs to do, so it remains a huge hog in the water,

defecating downstream. Moreover, Microsoft (of whom I am no friend) is in a

much better poisiton than whoever makes Informix, to develop it to do the

things that will be needed in the future, and it has been doing those things.

Fianlly, it is far easier to find good SQLS DBAs when needed than to find

Informix DBAs, which creates a dangerous vulnerability for your company.

Most likely, for your company -as most - your data are the company jewels,

worthy of protection.

Phil

Date sent: Wed, 01 May 2002 11:39:06 -0400

From: “Phillips, Rob via sql-server-l”

Well, we have a Informix server that is our main DB. The lease is up on

that server this fall and we have been pushing to move off of informix and

onto SQL2000. We have a few SQL2000 server which have been holding data for

our newer applications whereas the informix box holds data for the legacy

apps and we have to migrate data between the two different platforms.

Management is reluctant to switch off of informix because we’ve never had

any problems with it. From the techie standpoint, we don’t have problems

with it because nobody really knows it well and we are reluctant to make any

changes to it. Plus it is a huge pain in the but to make changes to it vs

making changes to SQL. So we have run some performance tests against the

two boxes and found that the SQL box running on a Single P4 processor to be

much faster than the Informix box running dual 333mhz RISC chips. (RS6000

running AIX)

We would like to have our own performance numbers, as well as some third

party performance comparisons, stability, manageability comparisons. And

some pros and cons of each to show to management so we can hopefully make

the switch.
